image.altText: Mr Squiggle and his blackboard on display.

props.synopsis: Mr Squiggle lit up TV screens for 40 years. Now, the National Museum of Australia in Canberra is displaying the show's iconic items.

title.children: Mr Squiggle, the man from the moon, is novel for kids, nostalgic for parents

image.altText: A uni lecturer

props.synopsis: The Australian National University announces more staff cuts across academic and professional roles, as part of its broader goal to save $250 million by the end of the year.

title.children: 'Awful': Amelia's in an ANU redundancy pool with two close colleagues

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the 38-year-old man went to a Canberra apartment looking for a woman who owed him $100,000, pushing his way in with another man and assaulting the couple inside.Â

title.children: Chinese national found guilty over part in violent home invasion

image.altText: A apartment building with cars driving on a main road in the foreground.

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble building with a sign reading "Law Court of the Australian Capital Territory".

image.altText: Three generations of women sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: For Canberra woman Belle Hogg, the first sign her life was about to change came when her mother forgot her birthday. Suddenly she found herself juggling full-time work, a photography business, raising her three children and caring for her mother.

title.children: Belle's aging mum forgot her birthday. It was the first sign of change

image.altText: Diogo Jota looks to the heavens and smiles

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

image.altText: Water spilling over the road as a truck drives in the background

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading higher this afternoon after Wall Street set record highs. image.altText: Composite image of Steve Smith, Shamar Joseph and Travis Head during an Australia-West Indies Test.

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

image.altText: A female Victorian politician dressed in black, wearing glasses, seated in an ABC TV studio

props.synopsis: Six new train stations linking Box Hill in Melbourne's east to Cheltenham in the south-east are under construction but the funding stream is not locked in yet.
